channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Families of killed men file first U.S. federal lawsuit over drug boat strikes
item.description: The case filed in Massachusetts is the first lawsuit over the strikes to land in a U.S. federal court since the Trump administration launched a campai...

item.title: Has sports betting become part of your daily routine? Tell us about it
item.description: It's never been easier to bet on sports. And polls show the majority of American men are involved in sports betting. To learn more, we want to hear fr...

item.title: After rocky start, Bari Weiss to cut staff, add commentators at CBS News
item.description: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss came in with a mandate to reshape coverage. She is set to announce plans for newsroom cuts and the hiring of many ...

item.title: A kids' guide to phone-free fun, from the author of 'The Anxious Generation'
item.description: Jonathan Haidt's 2024 book made the case that screen time had "rewired" kids' brains. The Amazing Generation is a collab with science journalist Cathe...

item.title: India and the EU clinch the 'mother of all deals' in a historic trade agreement
item.description: India and the European Union have reached a free trade agreement, at a time when Washington targets them both with steep import tariffs, pushing major...

item.title: 'It's 2C in our flat': Inside Kyiv apartment as Russia targets power and heating
item.description: Russian strikes targeting energy infrastructure have left millions without power in freezing temperatures.

item.title: Judge in Minnesota orders ICE chief to appear in court
item.description: The judge ordered the acting head of ICE to appear in his courtroom on Friday and explain why he should not be held in contempt of court.

item.title: Amazon is closing its Amazon Fresh grocery and Go convenience stores
item.description: Amazon acknowledged it hasn't yet "created a truly distinctive customer experience" in announcing move to scale back its brick-and-mortar grocery busi...

item.title: 'Crying horse' toys go viral in China ahead of Lunar New Year
item.description: Shop owners say the frowning toys - originally made in error - are resonating with young workers.

item.title: "Doomsday Clock" moves to closest point yet to catastrophe
item.description: The "Doomsday Clock" is a metaphor for how close humanity is to self-annihilation.

item.title: Judge tosses Justice Department lawsuit seeking Oregon voter rolls
item.description: The Justice Department filed a lawsuit against Oregon in September seeking its voter registration list, which contains the sensitive information of ne...

item.title: Millions of Americans face frigid temperatures as power outages persist for some
item.description: Deaths linked to the winter storm that swept across the U.S. are climbing. CBS News' Nicole Valdes reports from Nashville, Tennessee, and Rob Marciano...

item.title: Firefighters battle 'emergency level' blazes in Australia heatwave
item.description: Firefighters in Victoria are battling at least six major fires amid a record-breaking heatwave.

item.title: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger
item.description: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

item.title: Watch: Huge landslide in Sicily after Storm Harry
item.description: More than 1,000 residents have been evacuated from their homes on the Italian island.

item.title: What to know about Tom Homan, Trump’s border czar, as he heads to Minneapolis
Bovino is set to leave Minneapolis as Trump reshuffles the leadership of his immigration crackdown
item.description: A federal judge is considering Minnesota’s challenge to the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.

item.title: In their words: An examination of statements Trump officials made about what led to Pretti’s death
